messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] June portfolio/assesments
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/28/2003 2:50:13 PM Eastern Standard Time, unschooling@prexar.com writes: Angela, What is CMSL? I know I have seen them I just cant recall?
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/28/2003 2:50:13 PM Eastern Standard Time,
unschooling@... writes:
Angela,
What is CMSL? I know I have seen them I just cant recall? If it is the one
that had the web site, their site said local/20 mile so I didn't sign up.
Our group has one scheduled I just dont want to not have enough information.
I have been to three or four of there meetings but I dont really have a sense
of what they are all about.
They say some are relaxed and some are not.

Laura
Who wishes us New Englanders could create our own Unschooling group!
>
> Laura,
> Are you going to the CMSL portfolio review? If you are, I have heard
> they are really laid back. They don't want to see progress, just what
> you've been up to this year. (you can bring lists of books you've read,
> a photo album, or nothing and just talk.) Suzanne will put you with
> other unschoolers if you ask her, I am sure.
>
> Angela



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] June portfolio/assesments
messages.msgSnippet: Laura, Are you going to the CMSL portfolio review?  If you are, I have heard they are really laid back.  They don t want to see progress, just what you ve been
messages.messageBody:
Laura,
Are you going to the CMSL portfolio review? If you are, I have heard
they are really laid back. They don't want to see progress, just what
you've been up to this year. (you can bring lists of books you've read,
a photo album, or nothing and just talk.) Suzanne will put you with
other unschoolers if you ask her, I am sure.

Angela


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: June portfolio/assesments
messages.msgSnippet: Hello, I have found a couple sites that have examples of portfolios. Here is the stuff I dont understand.... When I am sitting there with all these other
messages.messageBody:
Hello,

I have found a couple sites that have examples of portfolios.
Here is the stuff I dont understand....
When I am sitting there with all these other parents in a circle and have say
15 minutes how do I fill that? Do I get asked questions or am I to fill this
whole time with talk about my son? Just the thought of me sitting there and
all these people staring at me while I explain what we do is making me
nervous.
What should I bring? Measuring cups, computer, surf board, trampoline, Fox
news yearly coverage, VCR tapes. Kidding but really she wants to see
progress, what is considered progress. He didn't know A in September and now
he does? How many examples per subject? Is it really as bad as I am making it
out to be?


Laura
Maine


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
